commInfra

Class ServerCom

  • java.lang.Object
    • commInfra.ServerCom

  • public class ServerCom
extends java.lang.Object
    Communication manager - server side. Communication is based on message passing over sockets using the TCP protocol. It supposes the setup of a communication channel between the two end points before data transfer can take place. Data transfer is bidirectional and is made through the transmission and the reception of objects in output and input streams, respectively.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerCom

        public ServerCom(int portNumb)
        Instantiation of a communication channel (form 1).
        Parameters:
        portNumb - number of the listening port at the computational system where the server is located

      • ServerCom

        public ServerCom(int portNumb,
                 java.net.ServerSocket lSocket)
        Instantiation of a communication channel (form 2).
        Parameters:
        portNumb - number of the listening port at the computational system where the server is located
        lSocket - listening socket

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Service setup. Instantiation of the listening socket and its binding to the public server address and port number.

      • end

        public void end()
        Service shutdown. The listening socket is closed.

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
                throws java.net.SocketException
        Set the timeout for listening.
        Parameters:
        timeout - listening timeout value (0 (zero) means infinite waiting time)
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - if the timeout value is negative

      • accept

        public ServerCom accept()
                 throws java.net.SocketTimeoutException
        Listening process. Instantiation of a communication channel for a pending request. Instantiation of the communication socket and its binding to the client address. The socket input and output streams are opened.
        Returns:
        reference to the commmunication channel
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketTimeoutException - if the timeout defined for listening expired

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the communication channel. The socket input and output streams are closed. The communication socket is closed.

      • readObject

        public java.lang.Object readObject()
        Object read from the communication channel.
        Returns:
        reference to the object that was read

      • writeObject

        public void writeObject(java.lang.Object toClient)
        Object write to the communication channel.
        Parameters:
        toClient - reference to the object to be written
